briefTitle: The Pharmacology and Hemodynamics of Dexmedetomidine in Children With Congenital Heart Disease
officialTitle: The Pharmacology of Dexmedetomidine in Children With Congenital Heart Disease
summary: The purpose of this study is to examine the pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and pharmacogenomics of dexmedetomidine in the following three pediatric patient populations: patients with bi-directional cavopulmonary anastomosis or a Fontan procedure, patients who have had a cardiac transplant, and patients with otherwise normal physiology who are undergoing closure of a patent ductus arteriosis or atrial septal defect.

primaryOutcome.measure: Changes in Hemodynamic Variables Recorded During Administration of Sevoflurane + Dexmedetomidine.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 24 hours following cardiac catheterization
